We're thrilled that so many members of our broader Openscapes community are presenting talks and posters at the [AGU Fall 2024 meeting](https://www.agu.org/annual-meeting). Browse below for details.

![](agu-fall-2024.png){fig-alt="AGU 2024 meeting logo white text on blue background says AGU24 Washington, DC | 9-13 December 2024 above a teal horizontal line, then text What's Next for Science" fig-align="center" width="400"}

## Monday Dec 09

**Talk**: \`py-rocket\`: A Docker image to promote cross-language (Python, R) collaboration across diverse user platforms for cloud computing in the earth sciences (Invited). Eli Holmes (NOAA Fisheries), Carl Boettiger (UC Berkeley), Luis López (NASA NSIDC). [AGU link](https://agu.confex.com/agu/agu24/meetingapp.cgi/Paper/1619232)

**Poster**: Supporting NASA Earthdata users in the Cloud: NASA Openscapes JupyterHub and User Onboarding & Fledging. Julie Lowndes (Openscapes) [AGU link](https://agu.confex.com/agu/agu24/meetingapp.cgi/Paper/1708480)

**Poster**: Including more solutions and more solvers via actionable open science. Julie Lowndes (Openscapes) [AGU link](https://agu.confex.com/agu/agu24/meetingapp.cgi/Paper/1709763)

## Tuesday Dec 10

**Poster**: Comparison of gas columns retrieved by TEMPO and Pandora – ASDC tools and results. 08:30 - 12:20 EST. Point of Contact: Daniel Kaufman (NASA ASDC) and Hazem Mahmoud (NASA ASDC)

## Wednesday Dec 11

**Poster**: The earthaccess Python Library: Awesome Discovery and Access of NASA Earthdata. 08:30 – 12:20 EST. Point of Contact: Amy Steiker (NASA NSIDC)

**Poster**: "PACE Hackweek: An open community keeping up with PACE" \@ 08:30 – 12:20 EST; Point of Contact: Ian Carroll (NASA/GSFC, UMBC)

## Thursday Dec 12

**Talk**: Chaining together Data Transformations in the Cloud for TEMPO Air Quality Measurements (Invited). 15:20 - 15:30 EST. Point of Contact: Daniel Kaufman (NASA ASDC), Hazem Mahmoud (NASA ASDC), and Matt Tisdale (NASA ASDC)

## Friday Dec 13

**Talk**: Cultivating open and collaborative data science at a U.S. EPA research center. 10:20 – 11:50 EST. Point of Contact: Gayle Hagler (EPA)

## Saturday Dec 14

**Hackday with Pangeo**: We'll join Pangeo hackday to meet and work with other awesome open science/cloud/geospatial folks!
